attributes.action: The UK Government has restricted Helplines, Period Product Websites, and more.
attributes.additional_details: Because some things are beneficial and not everything needs to be censored, also the government didn't even consider the consequences and when people tried to repeal it they said "Thanks for signing, but nope." And they didn't even try to consider any of the bad things. Children and teens need access to places where they can get help without needing parental guidance. It has been said children can't access childlike either which puts children in abusive households at risk.
attributes.background: The Government is fine for blocking pornography, but what about the people under 18 who want access to helplines and information about sex (Not porn, but some teens are suffering from STIs and need to access help.) And young women who want info/help about periods? Many things were vanished!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.  

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
 
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
